column2: The Other, being Disinclined to Change or Diversity of Scene, remained all his Life in One Place.
column3: The Other, being Disinclined to Change or Diversity of Scene, remained all his Life in One Place.

column2: He therefore Became Narrow-Minded and Provincial, and gained None of the Culture and Liberality of Nature which comes from Contact with various Scenes of Life.
column3: He therefore Became Narrow Minded and Provincial, and gained None of the Culture and Liberality of Nature which comes from Contact with various Scenes of Life.

column2: A LETTER
column3: A LETTER

column2: FROM PETROLEUM V. NASBY
column3: FROM PETROLEUM v NASBY

column2: I AM REQUESTED TO ACT AS CHAPLAIN OF THE CLEVELAND CONVENTION.--THAT BEAUTIFUL CITY VISITED FOR THAT PURPOSE.
column3: I a m REQUESTED TO a c t AS CHAPLAIN OF THE CLEVELAND CONVENTION.--THAT BEAUTIFUL CITY VISITED FOR THAT PURPOSE.

column2: POST OFFIS, CONFEDRIT X ROADS, (wich is in the Stait uv Kentucky), September 20, 1866.
column3: POST OFFIS, c o n f e d r i t X ROADS, (wich is in the Stait u v Kentucky), september twentieth eighteen sixty six.

column2: I wuz sent for to come to Washington, from my comfortable quarters at the Post Offis, to attend the convenshun uv sich soldiers and sailors uv the United States ez bleeve in a Union uv 36 States, and who hev sworn allejinse to a flag with 36 stars onto it, at Cleveland.
column3: I w u z sent for to come to Washington, from my comfortable quarters at the Post Offis, to attend the convenshun u v sich soldiers and sailors u v the United States e z bleeve in a Union u v thirty six States, and who h e v sworn allejinse to a flag with thirty six stars onto it, at Cleveland.

column2: My esteemed and life-long friend and co-laborer, Rev.
column3: My esteemed and life-long friend and co laborer, Rev.

column2: Henry Ward Beecher, wuz to hev bin the chaplin uv the convenshun, but he failed us, and it wuz decided in a Cabinet meetin that I shood take his place.
column3: Henry Ward Beecher, w u z to h e v bin the chaplin u v the convenshun, but he failed us, and it w u z decided in a Cabinet meetin that I shood take his place.

column2: I didn't see the necessity uv hevin a chaplin at every little convenshun uv our party, and so stated; but Seward remarked, with a groan, that ef ever there wuz a party, since parties wuz invented, wich needed prayin for, ours wuz that party.
column3: I didn't see the necessity u v hevin a chaplin at every little convenshun u v our party, and so stated; but Seward remarked, with a groan, that e f ever there w u z a party, since parties w u z invented, wich needed prayin for, ours w u z that party.

column2: And, Parson, sed he, glancin' at a list uv delegates, "ef yoo hev any agonizin petitions, any prayers uv extra fervency, offer em up for these fellers.
column3: And, Parson, s e d he, glancin' at a list u v delegates, "e f yoo h e v any agonizin petitions, any prayers u v extra fervency, offer em up for these fellers.

column2: Ef there is any efficacy in prayer, it's my honest, unbiased opinion that there never wuz in the history uv the world, nor never will be agin, sich a magnificent chance to make it manifest.
column3: e f there is any efficacy in prayer, it's my honest, unbiased opinion that there never w u z in the history u v the world, nor never will be agin, sich a magnificent chance to make it manifest.

column2: Try yoor-self particularly on Custer; tho', after all," continyood he, in a musin, abstracted sort uv a way, wich he's fallen into lately, "the fellow is sich a triflin bein, that he reely kin hardly be held 'sponsible for what he's doin; and the balance uv em, good Hevens! they'r mostly druv to it by hunger." And the Secretary maundered on suthin about "sixty days" and "ninety days," payin no more attention to the rest uv us than ez ef we wuzn't there at all.
column3: Try yoor self particularly on Custer; tho', after all," continyood he, in a musin, abstracted sort u v a way, wich he's fallen into lately, "the fellow is sich a triflin bein, that he reely kin hardly be held 'sponsible for what he's doin; and the balance u v em, good Hevens! they'r mostly d r u v to it by hunger." And the Secretary maundered on suthin about "sixty days" and "ninety days," payin no more attention to the rest u v us than e z e f we wuzn't there at all.

column2: So, receevin transportashen and suffishent money from the secret service fund for expenses, I departed for Cleveland, and after a tejus trip thro' an Ablishn country, I arrived there.
column3: So, receevin transportashen and suffishent money from the secret service fund for expenses, I departed for Cleveland, and after a tejus trip thro' an Ablishn country, I arrived there.

column2: My thots were gloomy beyond expression.
column3: My thots were gloomy beyond expression.

column2: I hed recently gone through this same country ez chaplin to the Presidential tour, and every stashen hed its pecooliar onpleasant remembrances.
column3: I hed recently gone through this same country e z chaplin to the Presidential tour, and every stashen hed its pecooliar onpleasant remembrances.

column2: Here wuz where the cheers for Grant were vociferous, with nary a snort for His Eggslency; there wuz where the peasantry laft in his face when he went thro' with the regler ritooal uv presentin the constitooshn and the flag with 36 stars onto it to a deestrick assessor; there wuz--but why recount my sufferins?
column3: Here w u z where the cheers for Grant were vociferous, with nary a snort for His Eggslency; there w u z where the peasantry laft in his face when he went thro' with the regler ritooal u v presentin the constitooshn and the flag with thirty six stars onto it to a deestrick assessor; there w u z-but why recount my sufferins?

column2: Why harrow up the public bosom, or lasserate the public mind?
column3: Why harrow up the public bosom, or lasserate the public mind?

column2: Suffice to say, I endoored it; suffice to say that I hed strength left to ride up Bank street, in Cleveland, the seen uv the most awful insult the Eggsecutive ever receeved.
column3: Suffice to say, I endoored it; suffice to say that I hed strength left to ride up Bank street, in Cleveland, the seen u v the most awful insult the Eggsecutive ever receeved.

column2: The evenin I arrived, the delegates, sich ez wuz on hand, held a informal meetin to arrange matters so ez they wood work smooth when the crowd finally got together.
column3: The evenin I arrived, the delegates, sich e z w u z on hand, held a informal meetin to arrange matters so e z they wood work smooth when the crowd finally got together.

column2: Genral Wool wuz ez gay and frisky ez though he reely belonged to the last ginerashn.
column3: Genral Wool w u z e z gay and frisky e z though he reely belonged to the last ginerashn.

column2: There wuz Custar, uv Michigan, with his hair freshly oiled and curled, and busslin about ez though he hed cheated hisself into the beleef that he reely amounted to suthin; and there wuz seventy-eight other men, who hed distinguished theirselves in the late war, but who hed never got their deserts, ceptin by brevet, owin to the fact that the Administrashn wuz Ablishn, which they wuzn't. They were, in a pekuniary pint uv view, suthin the worse for wear, tho' why that shood hev bin the case I coodent see (they hevin bin, to an alarmin extent, quarter-masters and commissaries, and in the recrootin service), til I notist the prevailin color uv their noses, and heerd one uv em ask his neighbor ef Cleveland wuz blest with a faro bank!
column3: There w u z Custar, u v Michigan, with his hair freshly oiled and curled, and busslin about e z though he hed cheated hisself into the beleef that he reely amounted to suthin; and there w u z seventy eight other men, who hed distinguished theirselves in the late war, but who hed never got their deserts, ceptin by brevet, owin to the fact that the Administrashn w u z Ablishn, which they wuzn't. They were, in a pekuniary pint u v view, suthin the worse for wear, tho' why that shood h e v bin the case I coodent see (they hevin bin, to an alarmin extent, quarter masters and commissaries, and in the recrootin service), til I notist the prevailin color u v their noses, and heerd one u v em ask his neighbor e f Cleveland w u z blest with a faro bank!

column2: Then I knowd all about it.
column3: Then I knowd all about it.

column2: There wuz another pekooliarity about it which for a time amoozed me. Them ez wuz present wuz divided into 2 classes--those ez hed bin recently appinted to posishens, and them ez expected to be shortly.
column3: There w u z another pekooliarity about it which for a time amoozed me. Them e z w u z present w u z divided into two classes-those e z hed bin recently appinted to posishens, and them e z expected to be shortly.

column2: I notist on the countenances uv the first class a look uv releef, sich ez I hev seen in factories Saturday nite, after the hands wuz paid off for a hard week's work; and on the other class the most wolfish, hungry, fierce expression I hev ever witnessed.
column3: I notist on the countenances u v the first class a look u v releef, sich e z I h e v seen in factories Saturday nite, after the hands w u z paid off for a hard week's work; and on the other class the most wolfish, hungry, fierce expression I h e v ever witnessed.

column2: Likewise, I notist that the latter set uv patriots talked more hefty uv the necessity uv sustainin the policy uv our firm and noble President, and damned the Ablishunists with more emphasis and fervency than the others.
column3: Likewise, I notist that the latter set u v patriots talked more hefty u v the necessity u v sustainin the policy u v our firm and noble President, and damned the Ablishunists with more emphasis and fervency than the others.

column2: One enthoosiastic individual, who hed bin quartermaster two years, and hed bin allowed to resign "jest after the battle, mother," wich, hevin his papers all destroyed, made settlin with the government a easy matter, wuz so feroshus that I felt called upon to check him.
column3: One enthoosiastic individual, who hed bin quartermaster two years, and hed bin allowed to resign "jest after the battle, mother," wich, hevin his papers all destroyed, made settlin with the government a easy matter, w u z so feroshus that I felt called upon to check him.

column2: Gently, my frend, sed I, "gently!
column3: Gently, my frend, s e d I, "gently!

column2: I hev bin thro' this thing; I hev my commission.
column3: I h e v bin thro' this thing; I h e v my commission.

column2: It broke out on me jest ez it hez on yoo; but yoo won't git yoor Assessorship a minit sooner for it."
column3: It broke out on me jest e z it h e z on yoo; but yoo won't git yoor Assessorship a minit sooner for it."

column2: It ain't a Assessorship I want, sez he.
column3: It ain't a Assessorship I want, sez he.

column2: I hev devoted myself to the task uv bindin up the wounds uv my beloved country--
column3: I h e v devoted myself to the task u v bindin up the wounds u v my beloved country-

column2: Did you stop anybody very much from inflictin them sed wounds? murmured I.
column3: Did you stop anybody very much from inflictin them s e d wounds? murmured i

column2: An ef I accept the Post Orfis in my native village,--which I hev bin solissited so strongly to take that I hev finally yielded,--I do it only that I may devote my few remainin energies wholly to the great cause uv restorin the 36 States to their normal posishens under the flag with 36 stars onto it, in spite uv the Joodis Iskariots wich, ef I am whom, wat is the Savior, and--and where is--
column3: An e f I accept the Post Orfis in my native village,--which I h e v bin solissited so strongly to take that I h e v finally yielded,--I do it only that I may devote my few remainin energies wholly to the great cause u v restorin the thirty six States to their normal posishens under the flag with thirty six stars onto it, in spite u v the Joodis Iskariots wich, e f I am whom, wat is the Savior, and-and where is-

column2: Perseevin that the unfortunate man hed got into the middle uv a quotashen from the speech uv our noble and patriotic President, and knowin his intellek wuzn't hefty enough to git it off jist as it wuz originally delivered, I took him by the throat, and shet off the flood uv his elokence.
column3: Perseevin that the unfortunate man hed got into the middle u v a quotashen from the speech u v our noble and patriotic President, and knowin his intellek wuzn't hefty enough to git it off jist as it w u z originally delivered, I took him by the throat, and shet off the flood u v his elokence.

column2: Be quiet, yoo idiot! remarked I, soothingly, to him.
column3: Be quiet, yoo idiot! remarked I, soothingly, to him.

column2: Yoo'll git your apintment, becoz, for the fust time in the history uv this or any other Republic, there's a market for jist sich men ez yoo; but all this blather won't fetch it a minit sooner.
column3: Yoo'll git your apintment, becoz, for the fust time in the history u v this or any other Republic, there's a market for jist sich men e z yoo; but all this blather won't fetch it a minit sooner.

column2: Good Lord! tho't I, ez I turned away, "wat a President A.J. is, to hev to buy up _sich_ cattle!
column3: Good Lord! tho't I, e z I turned away, "wat a President a j is, to h e v to buy up underscore sich underscore cattle!

column2: Wat a postmaster he must be, whose gineral cussedness turns _my_ stummick!"
column3: Wat a postmaster he must be, whose gineral cussedness turns underscore my underscore stummick!"

column2: It wuz deemed necessary to see uv wat we wuz compozed; whatever Kernel K----, who is now Collector uv Revenue in Illinoy, asked ef there wuz ary man in the room who hed bin a prizner doorin the late fratricidle struggle.
column3: It w u z deemed necessary to see u v wat we w u z compozed; whatever Kernel K----, who is now Collector u v Revenue in Illinoy, asked e f there w u z ary man in the room who hed bin a prizner doorin the late fratricidle struggle.

column2: A gentleman uv, perhaps, thirty aroze, and sed he wuz.
column3: A gentleman u v, perhaps, thirty aroze, and s e d he w u z.

column2: He hed bin taken three times, and wuz, altogether, 18 months in doorance vile in three diffrent prizns.
column3: He hed bin taken three times, and w u z, altogether, eighteen months in doorance vile in three different prizns.

column2: Custar fell on his neck, and asked him, aggitatidly, ef he wuz shoor--quite shoor, after sufferin all that, that he supported the policy of the President?
column3: Custar fell on his neck, and asked him, aggitatidly, e f he w u z shoor-quite shoor, after sufferin all that, that he supported the policy of the President?

column2: Are you quite shoor--quite shoor?
column3: Are you quite shoor-quite shoor?

column2: I am, returned the phenomenon.
column3: I am, returned the phenomenon.

column2: I stand by Andrew Johnson and his policy, and I don't want no office!
column3: I stand by Andrew Johnson and his policy, and I don't want no office!

column2: Hev yoo got wun? shouted they all in korus.
column3: h e v yoo got wun? shouted they all in korus.

column2: Nary! sed he.
column3: Nary! s e d he.

column2: With me it is a matter uv principle!
column3: With me it is a matter u v principle!

column2: Wat prizns wuz yoo incarcerated in? asked I, lookin at him with wonder.
column3: Wat prizns w u z yoo incarcerated in? asked I, lookin at him with wonder.

column2: Fust at Camp Morton, then at Camp Douglas, and finally at Johnson's Island!
column3: Fust at Camp Morton, then at Camp Douglas, and finally at Johnson's Island!

column2: Custar dropt him, and the rest remarked that, while they hed a very helthy opinion uv him, they guessed he'd better not menshen his presence, or consider hisself a delegate.
column3: Custar dropt him, and the rest remarked that, while they hed a very helthy opinion u v him, they guessed he'd better not menshen his presence, or consider hisself a delegate.

column2: Ez ginerous foes they loved him ruther better than a brother; yet, as the call didn't quite inclood him, tho' there wuz a delightful oneness between em, yet, ef 'twuz all the same, he hed better not announce hisself.
column3: e z ginerous foes they loved him ruther better than a brother; yet, as the call didn't quite inclood him, tho' there w u z a delightful oneness between em, yet, e f 't w u z all the same, he hed better not announce hisself.

column2: He wuz from Kentucky, I afterwards ascertained.
column3: He w u z from Kentucky, I afterwards ascertained.

column2: The next mornin, suthin over two hundred more arriv; and the delegashens bein all in, it wuz decided to go on with the show.
column3: The next mornin, suthin over two hundred more arriv; and the delegashens bein all in, it w u z decided to go on with the show.

column2: A big tent hed bin brought on from Boston to accommodate the expected crowd, and quite an animated discussion arose ez to wich corner uv it the Convenshun wuz to ockepy.
column3: A big tent hed bin brought on from Boston to accommodate the expected crowd, and quite an animated discussion arose e z to wich corner u v it the Convenshun w u z to ockepy.

column2: This settled, the biznis wuz begun.
column3: This settled, the biznis w u z begun.

column2: Genral Wool wuz made temporary Chairman, to wich honor he responded in a elokent extemporaneous speech, which he read from manuscript.
column3: Genral Wool w u z made temporary Chairman, to wich honor he responded in a elokent extemporaneous speech, which he read from manuscript.

column2: General Ewing made another extemporaneous address, which he read from manuscript, and we adjourned for dinner.
column3: General Ewing made another extemporaneous address, which he read from manuscript, and we adjourned for dinner.

column2: The dinner hour was spent in caucussin privately in one uv the parlors uv the hotel.
column3: The dinner hour was spent in caucussin privately in one u v the parlors u v the hotel.

column2: The Chairman asked who shood make speeches after dinner, wen every man uv em pulled from his right side coat pocket a roll uv manuscript, and sed he hed jotted down a few ijees wich he hed conclooded to present extemporaneously to the Convenshun.
column3: The Chairman asked who shood make speeches after dinner, wen every man u v em pulled from his right side coat pocket a roll u v manuscript, and s e d he hed jotted down a few ijees wich he hed conclooded to present extemporaneously to the Convenshun.

column2: That Babel over, the Chairman sed he presoomed some one shood be selected to prepare a address; whereupon every delegate rose, and pulled a roll uv manuscript from his left side coat pocket, and sed he had jotted down a few ijees on the situashn, wich he proposed to present, et settry.
column3: That Babel over, the Chairman s e d he presoomed some one shood be selected to prepare a address; whereupon every delegate rose, and pulled a roll u v manuscript from his left side coat pocket, and s e d he had jotted down a few ijees on the situashn, wich he proposed to present, et settry.

column2: This occasioned another shindy; wen the Chairman remarked "Resolushens," wen every delegate rose, pulled a roll uv manuscript from his right breast coat pocket, and sed he hed jotted down a few ijees, wich, etc.
column3: This occasioned another shindy; wen the Chairman remarked "Resolushens," wen every delegate rose, pulled a roll u v manuscript from his right breast coat pocket, and s e d he hed jotted down a few ijees, wich, etc

column2: I stood it until some one mentioned me ez Chaplin to the expedition West, when the pressure becum unendurable.
column3: I stood it until some one mentioned me e z Chaplin to the expedition West, when the pressure becum unendurable.

column2: They sposed I was keeper uv the President's conscience, and I hed not a minit's peece after that.
column3: They sposed I was keeper u v the President's conscience, and I hed not a minit's peece after that.

column2: In vain I ashoored em that, there bein no consciences about the White House, no one could hold sich a offis; in vain I ashoored em that I hed no influence with His Majesty.
column3: In vain I ashoored em that, there bein no consciences about the White House, no one could hold sich a offis; in vain I ashoored em that I hed no influence with His Majesty.

column2: Two-thirds uv em pulled applicashens for places they wanted from the left breast coat pocket, and insistid on my takin em, and seem that they was appinted.
column3: Two thirds u v em pulled applicashens for places they wanted from the left breast coat pocket, and insistid on my takin em, and seem that they was appinted.

column2: I told em that I cood do nuthin for em; but they laft me to skorn.
column3: I told em that I cood do nuthin for em; but they laft me to skorn.

column2: You are jist the style uv man, said they, "who hez inflooence with His Eggslency, and yoo must do it." Hemmed in, there wuz but one way uv escape, and that way I took. Seezin a carpet sack, wich, by the way, belonged to a delegate (I took it to give myself the look of a traveler), I rushed to the depot, and startid home, entirely satisfied that ef Cleveland may be taken as a sample, the less His Majesty depends on soljers, the better.
column3: You are jist the style u v man, said they, "who h e z inflooence with His Eggslency, and yoo must do it." Hemmed in, there w u z but one way u v escape, and that way I took. Seezin a carpet sack, wich, by the way, belonged to a delegate (I took it to give myself the look of a traveler), I rushed to the depot, and startid home, entirely satisfied that e f Cleveland may be taken as a sample, the less His Majesty depends on soljers, the better.
